case_title: Province of Punjab through Conservator of Forest, Faisalabad, etc vs Javed Iqbal
appellant: Province of Punjab through Conservator of Forest, Faisalabad, etc

key_issues.legal_question: Whether the proviso to section 21 of the Punjab Employees Efficiency, Discipline and Accountability Act, 2006 is directory or mandatory?
key_issues.provision_analysis: Proviso to section 21 mandates that departmental proceedings against retired employees must be finalized within two years of retirement.

reasoning: Legislative intent prioritizes efficiency and accountability within strict timelines.
Proviso uses mandatory language ('shall') and negative phrasing ('not later than').
Proceedings finalized after two years of retirement are void.
precedents: Muhammad Zaheer Khan vs. Government of Pakistan, 2010 SCMR 1554
Muhammad Anwar Bajwa vs. Chairman, Agricultural Development Bank of Pakistan, 2001 PLC (CS) 336
Province of the Punjab v. Munir Hussain Shah, 1998 SCMR 1326

future_guidance.recommendation: Government must fast-track cases of retired employees to conclude within statutory timelines.
future_guidance.policy_rationale: Avoid unnecessary expense and ensure retired employees enjoy peaceful retirement.
